channel.title: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP
channel.description:
Well i am running my source through Eclipse and i got this big error all of a sudden
[code][8/21/14 10:42 PM]: Starting up... [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: [ObjectDef] DONE LOADING OBJECT CONFIGURATION [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: [Region] DONE LOADING REGION CONFIGURATIONS [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: Exception in thread "main" [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: java.net.BindException: Address already in use: bind [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind0(Native Method) [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source) [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Unknown Source) [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Source) [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source) [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.registerNew(SocketAcceptor.java:363) [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.access$800(SocketAcceptor.java:55) [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor$Worker.run(SocketAcceptor.java:222) [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NamePreservingRunnable.java:51) [8/21/14 10:42 PM]: at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]
Anyone help me!

item.title: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

If its in Eclipse, you should check if there is another server instanceat the bottom of the output window

Read full topic
item.source: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP

item.title: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

[quote=“Bl3nd, post:5, topic:546143”][quote author=Camballer link=topic=665039.msg4445664#msg4445664 date=1408665375]

The system cannot find the path specified. Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
This is not an error. This shows that it compiled successfully. If it says error connecting - retying, then it can’t find the cache. The link is dead, or you didn’t zip it properly. Check your cachedownloader.
[/quote]

It may have compiled successfully but you would want to fix the “The system cannot find the path specified” which is easily fixed by changing the “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_20\bin\javac.exe”. You just have to go into the Java folder and find the directory to the actual jdk you have.[/quote]
It might not be necessary, unless your have more than one path, which would be stupid. Post your compiler.

Read full topic
item.source: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP

item.title: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

[quote=“Camballer, post:4, topic:546143”]The system cannot find the path specified. Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
This is not an error. This shows that it compiled successfully. If it says error connecting - retying, then it can’t find the cache. The link is dead, or you didn’t zip it properly. Check your cachedownloader.[/quote]

It may have compiled successfully but you would want to fix the “The system cannot find the path specified” which is easily fixed by changing the “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_20\bin\javac.exe”. You just have to go into the Java folder and find the directory to the actual jdk you have.

Read full topic
item.source: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP

item.title: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

The system cannot find the path specified. Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
This is not an error. This shows that it compiled successfully. If it says error connecting - retying, then it can’t find the cache. The link is dead, or you didn’t zip it properly. Check your cachedownloader.

Read full topic
item.source: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP

item.title: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP
item.dc:creator: @litle_fela1 litle fela1
item.description:
@litle_fela1 wrote:

Bl3nd:

There is already something running connecting to that port. Check if the server is already running or it sometimes is Skype, and also, look for something such as Javaw in your task manager and end them.

The client didnt come with a run.batch for the client so i made my own and it doesnt work

@echo off TITLE Grahams Project cd 474 Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_20\bin\javac.exe" *.java java -Xmx500m client 0 live live lowmem members english game0 pause

i have tried that but it gives me this:

The system cannot find the path specified. Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.

it then opens a Client and says “Connect error - retrying in 20”

Read full topic
item.source: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP

item.title: Starting Up my 317 loading 474 - ERROR HELP
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

There is already something running connecting to that port. Check if the server is already running or it sometimes is Skype, and also, look for something such as Javaw in your task manager and end them.

Read full topic
